security_audit.summary: All 150 static findings are false positives. The skill is a legitimate bioinformatics library with no shell commands, no cryptographic operations, and no malicious network behavior. Backticks flagged in markdown are code formatting delimiters, not Ruby/shell execution. Network requests target only the public Open Targets GraphQL API for therapeutic target research.

content.user_title: Query Open Targets for therapeutic targets
content.value_statement: Find therapeutic targets and drug candidates using Open Targets Platform data. Access genetic evidence, tractability assessments, safety data, and known drugs for target-disease associations.
actual_capabilities: Search targets, diseases, and drugs by name or identifier
Retrieve target annotations including tractability and safety data
Get disease information with associated targets and drugs
Query known drugs for diseases with clinical trial phases
Access drug mechanisms of action and indications
limitations: API is designed for exploratory queries, not bulk data retrieval
Association scores rank relative evidence, not predict clinical success
Under-studied diseases may have lower scores despite valid evidence
No authentication required but proper citation is required for data use

use_cases.title: Identify novel targets
use_cases.description: Find potential therapeutic targets for a disease by querying genetic evidence and tractability data.

use_cases.title: Cross-reference evidence
use_cases.description: Gather supporting evidence for target-disease links from multiple data sources and evidence types.

use_cases.title: Find drug repurposing
use_cases.description: Identify existing drugs for a disease that could be repurposed based on target mechanisms.

prompt_templates.title: Find gene targets
prompt_templates.prompt: Find genes associated with [DISEASE] that have good genetic evidence and tractability data.

prompt_templates.title: Get evidence details
prompt_templates.prompt: What evidence supports the association between [GENE] and [DISEASE]?

prompt_templates.title: Check drug options
prompt_templates.prompt: List known drugs for [DISEASE] and their clinical trial phases.

prompt_templates.title: Compare targets
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare tractability, safety, and genetic constraint for [GENE1] and [GENE2].

output_examples.input: Find targets for Alzheimer's disease with genetic evidence
output: BRCA1 - associated with score 0.85, evidence from GWAS and genetic association
PICALM - tractability: predicted druggable, safety: no liabilities reported
CLU - known drugs: none in clinical trials, expression data available

best_practices: Start with genetic evidence as the strongest indicator of disease relevance
Consider multiple evidence types for confidence in target selection
Check tractability assessments before prioritizing targets
Review safety liabilities for potential toxicity concerns
anti_patterns: Using association scores as absolute confidence measures
Relying on single evidence source for critical decisions
Ignoring under-studied diseases that may score lower
Missing proper citation of Open Targets Platform in publications

faq.question: What is Open Targets Platform?
faq.answer: A public database integrating genetics, omics, and literature data for therapeutic target identification.

faq.question: Do I need API access?
faq.answer: No authentication required. The GraphQL API is freely accessible for research and commercial use.

faq.question: What entities can I query?
faq.answer: Targets (genes), diseases (EFO IDs), and drugs (ChEMBL IDs) with comprehensive annotations.

faq.question: How to filter by evidence type?
faq.answer: Use the data_types parameter in get_target_disease_evidence to filter evidence categories.

faq.question: What are association scores?
faq.answer: Relative rankings of evidence strength from 0-1, not absolute confidence measures.

faq.question: How often is data updated?
faq.answer: Open Targets Platform is updated quarterly with new data releases.
